definition: to copy/to imitate/to make by imitating a model
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Anything else is a sham, a pale imitation.
sentences.chinese: 别的都是骗局，都是苍白的仿制品。

sentences.english: Silk Street used to be full of fakes and imitations.
sentences.chinese: 秀水街原来都是假货和仿制品。

sentences.english: This slows down or even prevents the development of generic and new vaccines.
sentences.chinese: 这减缓甚至阻止了仿制疫苗和新疫苗的开发。

sentences.english: If I can’t have the real thing, I can make do with the imitation.
sentences.chinese: 如果我得不到真品，那也可以用仿制品对付一下。

sentences.english: They sought out potters who had once made copies of the ancient vessels.
sentences.chinese: 他们寻找曾经仿制过古代器皿的陶工。

sentences.english: It was some kind of plastic made to imitate iron.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种塑胶，但外观仿制得像铁。

sentences.english: High quality imitation Chinese coins, perfect for all of your routines .
sentences.chinese: 高质量仿制中国古钱币，能用于你所有的魔术流程里。

sentences.english: The impostors pose the latest counterfeiting headache for the tech giant.
sentences.chinese: 假冒者们制造的最新仿制品令科技巨头头痛。

sentences.english: The copycats will be less expensive than the originals, but they will never be cheap.
sentences.chinese: 这些仿制药绝不会比专利药昂贵，但肯定也不会便宜。

sentences.english: Knock-offs may be seeping into the market.
sentences.chinese: 所以很多仿制品可能已经渗入市场。

sentences.english: Copying other people's inventions have a "white car" interests.
sentences.chinese: 仿制别人的发明成果具有一种“白搭车”的利益。
也可以买到质量很好的仿制品。

sentences.english: The mockups are used to support training on installation and removal procedures.
sentences.chinese: 仿制品用来支持有关安装和去除程序的训练。

sentences.english: Using real metal, glass or crystal instead of plastic simulations.
sentences.chinese: 使用真金属，玻璃或水晶代替塑料仿制品。

sentences.english: They are very good copiers of products.

definition: to copy/to produce sth after a model/to counterfeit
to try out a new product (or manufacturing process)/prototype/trial product
standardized/standard (service, method etc)/regulation (clothing etc)/formulaic/(telecommunications etc) system/format (e.g. the PAL or NTSC systems for TV signals)
model (particular version of a manufactured article)/type (product specification in terms of color, size etc)
